channel.title: git on David Amador
channel.description: Recent content in git on David Amador

item.title: Converting the blog from WordPress to Hugo
item.description: Yesterday, I shutdown the VPS that has been hosting all my websites for the last ~10 years. I’ve moved everything to static content, including this website. üìù WordPress Since the very beginning (~2008) this blog has been powered by WordPress, it served me well, it worked, had a nice backend to make the posts, plugins and themes. After a couple years I moved from shared hosting to a VPS, I had other websites and services I needed running and all in same machine was better and cheaper.

item.title: Using Git for revision control
item.description: If you are coding, no matter what it is, games, software, websites, you should be using a code revision control of some sort. Are you using? Cool. Is it Git? Smart choice, so you probably don‚Äôt need to read the rest of this post. For the rest I‚Äôm giving some help on how to start from scratch. First of all I recommend some reading on Revision Control so that you understand what I‚Äôm talking about.

item.title: Tech Talk: Linus Torvalds On Git
item.description: I recently found that there is a subversion alternative surfacing that is in many ways much better that subversion, it name is Git and it‚Äôs a creation of Linus Torvalds. Here‚Äôs a video of him talking about it
